thread.title: Tinashe poses for Playboy; Chris Rock may host Oscars; 'BTTF' newspaper: AM Buzz
thread.title_full: Tinashe poses for Playboy; Chris Rock may host Oscars; 'BTTF' newspaper: AM Buzz | syracuse.com

author: Geoff Herbert | gherbert@syracuse.com
title: Tinashe poses for Playboy; Chris Rock may host Oscars; 'BTTF' newspaper: AM Buzz
text:
"2 On" singer Tinashe is posing for Playboy to promote her upcoming sophomore album, "Joyride." Of course, the magazine recently did away with nude photos so it shouldn't surprise you that the 22-year-old hitmaker is wearing clothes -- though she does show plenty of curves. "Sexuality has always been part of who I am as an artist—emphasis on part," Tinashe, who got her start as the model for a character in Tom Hanks' "The Polar Express" and performed at Syracuse University's 2014 Juice Jam concert, says. "I'm an all-around entertainer, my own creative force, and I'm bringing something fresh to the table."
» See the photos at Playboy and a behind-the-scenes video at Vibe .
Will Chris Rock host the Oscars again? The actor-comedian hosted the Academy Awards in 2005, and he's reportedly in talks with producers (one of whom did "Everybody Hates Chris") to helm the 2016 show on Feb. 28. The gig has been fraught with public criticism in recent years, though, and Rock famously aggravated Sean Penn when he made fun of Jude Law at the '05 ceremony.
» Read more at E! News .
USA Today is celebrating "Back to the Future" Day tomorrow, even though today, October 21, 2015, is the day Marty McFly and Doc Brown travel to in "Part II." ( See which predictions came true! ) In the movie, the next day's Hill Valley edition of USA Today is used to see if a headline changes -- so the newspaper is releasing a special front page on Oct. 22 that looks like the one in the movie, complete with stories about a female president, "Jaws 19" and Mothers Against Drunk Flying. One tidbit's changed, though: No news about "Queen Diana."
» See the USA Today special cover at HitFix .
And Bruce Willis is on board with a "Die Hard" prequel . "It's a very good idea, a really tricky idea, and I'm very happy about it," the 60-year-old actor said at the premiere of his new film "Rock the Kasbah" in New York. "It's a really cool idea, because it's the origin story... We're going to bounce back and forth." So " Die Hard 6 " will include Willis as John McClane today, as well as another actor playing the younger version (that will presumably reboot the franchise). Yippie-ki-yay?
» Read more at Entertainment Tonight .
